review_blob: Bevuta alla spina a "La piccola Abbazia", Roma. Limpida, colore biondo intenso con qualche riflesso ambrato. Schiuma bianca, compatta ed abbondante, di eccezionale persistenza. Naso leggero e non troppo persistente, sentori di erba fresca, fiori di campo, qualche nota agrumata. In bocca il malto fa da padrone, sebbene bilanciato da un discreto amaro; lievi note erbacee e speziate sono donate dallo styrian golding. Nel complesso lho trovata una birra estremamente piacevole ed equilibrata. Consigliata.
beer_name: Wells Charlie Wells Dry Hopped Lager

review_blob:
Bottiglia da 0,33 a casa, grazie a Davide del regalo.
Limpida (filtrata?), sorprendentemente rosso scuro-mogano. Un dito e mezzo di schiuma persistente color beige, con poche bolle a grana piccola. Aroma mediamente intenso e non eccessivamente persistente; caff tostato, agrumi, pino/resina. Carbonazione giusta, corpo medio-leggero. Amaro moderato ma piuttosto persistente. Roasted, cioccolato, caff, pompelmo, arancia, resina. Si sente lavena, alcol ben nascosto. Nel complesso ben equilibrata e con una discreta bevibilit nonostante lABV. Da provare.

On tap at Barley Wine, Roma. Deep black with ruby reflections, cappuccino froth, with just some medium bubbles, and consistent Brussels lace. Aroma is intense but not persistent; coffee, chocolate with orange, something spicy like red or black pepper in the back of the nasal cavity. Bitterness is medium but really longlasting, medium to small body, almost watery. Coffee, chocolate, pepper, citrus fruit, tobacco. Red pepper aftertaste. Full confidence in this great brewery! I usually dont appreciate Black Ipa because of their excessively aggressive taste and their lack of equilibrium, but this one is really well balanced. Good job.

On tap at Barley Wine, Rome. Straw, whitish yellow, turbid, no head, just an evanescent Brussels lace on the glass. Intense aroma, pungent, acrid, medium persistent; rice starch, pear, mold. Pretty watery, with a strong and longlasting mouthfeel. Taste is citric and lactic, maybe a bit salty in the end. Moldy grapefruit and lemon. 

Very interesting beer, as an experiment. In my humble opinion lacks complexity and (a little more) balance. However something worthy to be remembered.
beer_name: Birrificio del Ducato Koji Il Riso

review_blob:
Bottle shared with my good friend Naso, at Gradi Plato Epiro. Dark sienna, with hazelnut and chestnut honey reflections. Almost absent head, just a sort of (pale) Brussels lace on the glass. Aroma medium intense; alcohol, strong liquorice, smoked wood, whiskey, coffee grounds, maybe some canned fruit (difficoult to perceive). Strong taste, longlasting and pretty complex. Good body. Liquorice, whiskey, earthy sensations. Sweet notes in the beginning, then an hot and alcoholic ending.

Definitely not my cup of tea, but still a good job from a great brewery.

Bottle at Gradi Plato Epiro, Rome. 

Orangish with golden reflctions, pretty turbid. A little persistent foam layer with just some little bubbles. 
Aroma is pretty intense, but not particularly lasting. Marzipan and bread, canned fruit, raisin. 
Coming to tasting, I have to say: Great body! Really dense, almost creamy mouthfeel. Start sweet, then you can appreciate a sour note, then remains a medium, dry, persistent bitterness. We can distinguish fruit, sugar, spices (pepper). Alchol flavor is soft despite the ABV.

Amazing in its complexity, perfect for aging.
